title: 103_s1514
content:
ADJUSTMENT OF APPROPRIATIONS COMMITTEES SECTION 302 ALLOCATIONS AND SUBALLOCATIONS. Section 302(e) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to address situations where appropriation bills are amended to reduce funding for programs, projects, or activities. If the House and Senate both reduce funding for the same program, project, or activity in their respective bills, then the suballocations made by each Committee for that fiscal year are adjusted accordingly. Upon the enactment of any rescission bill, suballocations for the fiscal year made by each Committee on Appropriations shall be adjusted based on reductions made by the House of Representatives or the Senate for programs, projects, or activities. The committee must report adjusted suballocations and allocations with reduced budget outlays and authority. Upon the enactment of a rescission bill, suballocations for the fiscal year by each Committee on Appropriations shall be reduced based on rescissions in the bill. The committee must report adjusted suballocations and allocations with reduced budget outlays and authority. SEC. 2. Adjustment of appropriations committees' allocations and suballocations. Section 602 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include new subsections regarding adjustments of Appropriations Committees Allocations and Suballocations when appropriation bills are amended to reduce funding for programs, projects, or activities. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include new subsections for adjustments of Appropriations Committees Allocations and Suballocations when appropriation bills are amended to reduce funding for programs, projects, or activities. This includes reducing suballocations for fiscal year made by each Committee on Appropriations and reporting adjusted suballocations and allocations with reduced budget outlays and authority. Further adjustments of Appropriations Committees Allocations are also allowed. Upon the passage of a rescission bill by both Houses of Congress, the suballocations for the fiscal year made by each Committee on Appropriations to any subcommittee with jurisdiction over the bill shall be reduced by the sum of the rescissions in that bill. The committee must report an adjusted suballocation for the subcommittee with appropriate reductions in budget outlays and authority, as well as an adjusted allocation for the committee with reduced budget outlays and authority. SEC. 3. CBO TRACKING.

Section 202 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include scorekeeping assistance for Committees on Appropriations to comply with sections 302(e)(2) and 602(f).

SEC. 4. ADJUSTMENT OF DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITS.

Section 601(a)(2) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include adjustments pursuant to section 602(f)(2)(B) and section 602(g)(2).
